page.title: 09Living in Fairfield,Buxton.
page.content: We are in Miss Pickering's class in Fairfield Endowed Junior School and we'd like to tell you about the Fairfield area. Fairfield used to be a more important village than Buxton, but now, in 1985, Fairfield is thought of as just a part of Buxton. Most of Fairfield's industry is on the new industrial estate. There aren't many firms there as most of the land in Fairfield is either used for housing or for farming. The farms stock cows and sheep. The area is hilly, being part of the Peak District and most of the rocks are limestone and Millstone Grit. There used to be a race course on Fairfield Common, now it is the area for a Golf Course. For recreation there is also Fairfield Centre which is on Victoria Park Road. You can find small shops near there too.
